intro: Aloe orpeniae, commonly known as the Cape aloe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically green with white or yellowish markings. The plant produces tall, branched flower stalks that bear yellow or orange flowers. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves. Aloe orpeniae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
